person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of James P. Lavin and Sisiter Superior M. Angelique for a Writ of Certiorari} No. 1078 Exceptions
In the Matter of the Application of Yvonne Le Fevre, Georgette Normand and Marie Le Fevre for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

Come now the petitioners above named, James P. Lavin and Sister Superior M. Angelique, by Edward E. Cushman, Assistant United States Attorney, and except to the order of remand and judgemnt entered herein on the 19th day of February, 1903;

1st. To the Court's finding that the only action warrant by petitioners and the Goverment's officers under the facts disclosed by the return, was the return of the applicants for a writ of habeas corpus to British Columbia, at the expense of the ship which brought them to this country.

2nd. To the Court's order and judgment remanding said applicats to the custody of James P. Lavin, with the direction to him to place them on the steamship Rosalie, to be retunedat its expense to Victoria, British Columbia.
3rd. To the Court's order on the 3rd day of March, 1903, refusing to modify said order on the 19th day of February, 1903.

4th. To the Court's finfing in its order and judgment on the 3rd day of March, 1903, that said applicats for a writ of habeas corpus were not subject,under the facts disclsed by the return and supplemental retun, to deportation to France.

5th. Tp the Court's assuming and execising authority and jurisdiction after the showing ans suggestion that the Secretary of the
Tresury had made and issued his warrant for the deposition of said aplicats for writ of habeas corpus to the Republic of France.
Edward E. Cushman Assistant United States Attorney
The foregoing exceptions are ech and all allowed by the Court. C.H. Howford Judge.
In the Circuit Court In District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of James P. Lavin & et all for
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. MAR 5 1903 A.REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Statiherd Dep.
